an6.77:1.1: “Mendicants, without giving up six qualities you can’t realize a superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones.
an6.77:1.3: Lack of mindfulness and situational awareness, not guarding the sense doors, eating too much, deceit, and flattery.
an6.77:1.4: Without giving up these six qualities you can’t realize a superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones.
an6.77:2.1: But after giving up six qualities you can realize a superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones.
an6.77:2.3: Lack of mindfulness and situational awareness, not guarding the sense doors, eating too much, deceit, and flattery.
an6.77:2.4: After giving up these six qualities you can realize a superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones.”
